component.text: <b>3.1.4 IA - D Classify Dynamic Routing Protocols

Activity, Topology - Determine the Exit Interface for a Given Packet
Use this topology diagram as a reference when answering each of the 3 scenarios. Click button 2 now.

Activity – Scenario 1: Determine the Exit Interface for a Given Packet
Drag each destination IP address to the correct exit interface on Router 3 (R3). Refer to the routing table and topology diagram. Click button 3 to continue.
You have successfully identified the correct exit interfaces for the destination IP addresses. Click button 3 to continue.
You have not successfully identified the correct exit interfaces for the destination IP addresses. Please click Reset to try again.

Activity – Scenario 2: Determine the Exit Interface for a Given Packet
Drag each destination IP address to the correct exit interface on Router 1 (R1). Refer to the routing table and topology diagram. Click button 4 to continue.
You have successfully identified the correct exit interfaces for the destination IP addresses. Click button 4 to continue.
You have not successfully identified the correct exit interfaces for the destination IP addresses. Please click Reset to try again.

Activity – Scenario 3: Determine the Exit Interface for a Given Packet
Drag each destination IP address to the correct exit interface on Router 2 (R2). Refer to the routing table and topology diagram.
You have successfully identified the correct exit interfaces for the destination IP addresses.
You have not successfully identified the correct exit interfaces for the destination IP addresses. Please click Reset to try again.
